verses.text: If a ruler listens to lies, all his officials become wicked.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:12
rsbNotes.text: 29:12 Corruption in society tends to start at the top. The dishonest ruler not only attracts evil officials, but encourages subordinates to become corrupt.

verses.text: The poor man and the oppressor have this in common: The LORD gives sight to the eyes of both.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:13
rsbNotes.text: 29:13 gives light to the eyes of both. God has created both rich and poor (22:2 and note).

verses.text: If a king judges the poor with fairness, his throne will always be secure.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:14
rsbNotes.text: 29:14 See v. 4; 16:12â€“15 and notes.
